data.title: Men's Basketball Notes - Nov. 11
data.meta_description: Nine Big Sky men’s basketball teams official open the season on Friday...Eastern Washington will play in the first basketball game in the nation, playing host to Texas Southern on Friday at 8 a.m. at Reese Court...Sacramento State opens its season at No. 13 Gonzaga
data.text:
This Week’s Sky Highlights

Nine Big Sky men’s basketball teams official open the season on Friday...Eastern Washington will play in the first basketball game in the nation, playing host to Texas Southern on Friday at 8 a.m. at Reese Court...Sacramento State opens its season at No. 13 Gonzaga...Weber State treks to rival Utah State, while Northern Arizona is at Xavier...Idaho State takes on New Mexico, and Southern Utah is at Kansas State...Montana State opens the Brian Fish era at UCLA...Idaho plays its first game under the Big Sky banner since 1996 on Friday at home against Eastern Oregon...Northern Colorado is at home against Black Hills State....The other three league teams open play on Saturday. North Dakota treks to Northern Iowa, while Portland State is at USC...First-year Montana coach Travis DeCuire takes his team to Colorado State...On Sunday, Northern Arizona is at Toledo, Idaho State is at Denver, Northern Colorado is at Wyoming, and Southern Utah is at Miami-Ohio...On Monday, Eastern Washington plays its second home game of the season against Utah Valley...Montana State is back in action against Grand Canyon of the WAC...Sacramento State takes on UC Riverside...Weber State has its home opener against Presentation, and Idaho welcomes South Dakota to Moscow.

This Week’s Sky Schedule

Date Game Time TV/Internet Friday, Nov. 14 Texas Southern at Eastern Washington 8:05 a.m. Pacific SWX

Watch Big Sky Friday, Nov. 14 Sacramento State at No. 13 Gonzaga 6:05 p.m. Pacific ROOT SPORTS

KHQ Friday, Nov. 14 Weber State at Utah State 7:05 p.m. Mountain Mountain West Digital Friday, Nov. 14 Eastern Oregon at Idaho 7:05 p.m. Pacific Watch Big Sky Friday, Nov. 14 Northern Arizona at Xavier 7:05 p.m. Eastern Fox College Sports Friday, Nov. 14 Black Hills State at Northern Colorado 7:05 p.m. Mountain Watch Big Sky Friday, Nov. 14 Idaho State at New Mexico 8:05 p.m. Mountain ROOT SPORTS Friday, Nov. 14 Southern Utah at Kansas State 8:05 p.m. Central Fox Sports Kansas City Friday, Nov. 14 Montana State at UCLA 9:05 p.m. Pacific Pac-12 Network Saturday, Nov. 15 North Dakota at Northern Iowa 1:05 p.m. Central Northern Iowa Web Site Saturday, Nov. 15 Portland State at Southern Cal 7:35 p.m. Pacific Pac-12 Network Saturday, Nov. 16 Montana at Colorado State 8:05 p.m. Mountain ROOT SPORTS Sunday, Nov. 16 Northern Arizona at Toledo 2:05 p.m. Eastern Toledo Web Site Sunday, Nov. 16 Southern Utah at Miami-Ohio 2:05 p.m. Eastern None Sunday, Nov. 16 Northern Colorado at Wyoming 2:05 p.m. Mountain Wyoming Web Site Sunday, Nov. 16 Idaho State at Denver 4:05 p.m. Mountain Denver Web Site Monday, Nov. 17 Utah Valley at Eastern Washington 5:05 p.m. Mountain Watch Big Sky Monday, Nov. 17 Montana State at Grand Canyon 7:05 p.m. Mountain Cox 7 Video Stream Monday, Nov. 17 South Dakota State at Idaho 7:05 p.m. Pacific Watch Big Sky Monday, Nov. 17 Sacramento State at UC Riverside 7:05 p.m. Pacific Big West TV Monday, Nov. 17 Presentation at Weber State 7:35 p.m. Mountain Watch Big Sky

Times Local to Site/Subject to Change

Around the Big Sky

COLLEGE BASKETBALL STARTS IN CHENEY: Eastern Washington’s football team played in the first college football game of the 2014 season on Aug. 23. The Eagle basketball team will play in the nation’s first Division I basketball game on Friday. Eastern Washington will play host to Texas Southern in a game that will start at 8 a.m. at Reese Court. SWX out of Spokane will televise the contest, which will also be available on Watch Big Sky. Jim Hayford’s Eagles were tabbed second by the coaches and third by the media in the preseason polls.

IDAHO RETURNS TO BIG SKY: The University of Idaho officially returned to the Big Sky Conference on July 1, 2014. Idaho was a charter member of the Big Sky, competing in the league from 1963-1996. The Vandals’ return gives the Big Sky 12 men’s basketball members. Idaho played in the WAC Championship game in 2014, losing to New Mexico State. The Vandals are coached by Don Verlin. Idaho’s first game under the Big Sky banner since 1996 comes Friday night as the Vandals play host to Eastern Oregon. Idaho won Big Sky postseason championships in 1981, 1982, 1989, and 1990. The Vandals last appeared in the Big Sky championship game in 1993.

WHAT’S NEW: Big Sky teams will no longer play a true double round-robin schedule. League teams will play 18 conference games. Each team will play seven teams twice and the other four teams once. Each team will have nine home and nine road conference games. The top eight teams will qualify for the 2015 Big Sky Championship, which will be played on March 12-14 at the site of the regular-season champion.

NEW COACHES IN THE TREASURE STATE: Montana and Montana State are both under the direction of first-year coaches. Montana State’s Brian Fish came to Bozeman from Oregon, where he served as an assistant coach under Dana Altman. Fish has also been an assistant at Creighton (twice), Kansas State, San Diego, TCU and Marshall. Fish replaced Brad Huse, who coached the Bobcats for eight seasons. DeCuire replaced Wayne Tinkle, who left Montana after eight seasons to become the head coach at Oregon State. DeCuire was a standout point guard for the Grizzlies from 1992-94 He spent the previous six years an assistant at Cal and the five years prior to that as an assistant at Old Dominion.

WSU, EWU RECEIVE VOTES: No Big Sky teams are ranked in the CollegeInsider.Com Mid-Major top 25, but both Weber State and Eastern Washington received votes. Wichita State is the preseason mid-major No. 1, followed by Gonzaga, Harvard, BYU and Northern Iowa. Weber State earned nine votes. Eastern Washington received five.

THREE IN THE NBA: Three former Big Sky basketball players are currently on active NBA rosters. Former Eastern Washington Eagle Rodney Stuckey is in his first season with the Indiana Pacers after spending the first seven seasons with the Detroit Pistons. Former Weber State great Damian Lillard is enjoying his third season with the Portland Trail Blazers. Lillard was the NBA Rookie of the Year in 2012-13, and was an All-Star last season. Former Montana guard Will Cherry made his NBA debut with the Cleveland Cavaliers on Nov. 7. Cherry scored his first NBA basket on Nov. 10 with an assist from LeBron James.

GARRITY 10TH IN DIMES: Sacramento State’s Dylan Garrity begins his senior season 10th in league history in assists with 443. Garrity needs 25 assists to tie former Nevada player Billy Allen for ninth. Garrity is 59 assists away from tying former Sacramento State Hornet DaShawn Freeman for eighth. Nevada’s Kevin Soares (1988-92) is the all-time leader with 716.
